page.title: 09ALDENHAM COUNTRY PARK
page.content: {Aldenham Country Park}was established in 1971 on former farmland surrounding a 65-acre lake excavated by French prisoners-of-war in 1795 to help maintain local river levels after the construction of the Grand Union Canal. Previously held as a reserve public water supply, as is the nearby Hilfield Reservoir, Aldenham Lake is now a leisure amenity for{anglers, {sailors and wind-surfers.}The park itself offers{wildlife}protection by conservation and careful management, but also encourages public access through{nature trails,}a small-animal corner and children's activity projects. The mixture of{meadows, {woodland}and{open water}provides a popular area for local recreation: particular attractions are the children's{adventure playground}and a herd of rare Longhorn beef cattle.
